channel.title: DotNET on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in DotNET on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: âš¡ Local Energy Assistant: C# + GPT-OSS + RAG
item.description:
Introduction

Imagine having an AI assistant that understands your energy consumption patterns, solar production, and weather data â€” all running locally on your machine with zero cloud dependencies. No API keys, no subscription fees, no data leaving your premises.

In this hands-on guide, we’ll build a Local Energy Assistant using C#, the open-source GPT-OSS-20B model, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and custom tool calling. Perfect for privacy-conscious developers who want intelligent insights from their smart meter data.

item.title: ðŸš€ .NET 9 Performance in Azure: A Deep Technical Dive
item.description:
.NET 9 represents a significant leap forward in performance optimization, particularly for Azure-hosted applications. With cloud costs continuing to rise and performance expectations at an all-time high, these improvements can directly impact both your application’s user experience and your Azure bill. Let’s explore the technical depths of what makes .NET 9 a game-changer for Azure workloads.

Executive Summary: The Performance Revolution

Before diving into the technical details, here’s what .NET 9 delivers for Azure applications:
